title: The Bachelor winner Matt Agnew looks unrecognisable as he debuts new look
text:
He's the handsome astrophysicist who drove the girls wild with his clean-cut looks while starring on The Bachelor.

But now he's a taken man, Matt Agnew is sporting a very different look.

The 32-year-old debuted a scruffy handle moustache in an Instagram photo his girlfriend Chelsie McLeod shared on Tuesday.

Who's that guy? The Bachelor winner Matt Agnew now looks unrecognisable after ditching his clean-cut look for a scruffy moustache

In the image, Matt is seen squatting down by a waterway and is dressed in a blue shirt and white shorts.

'If you moustache, I’m dating this guy now,' Chelsie captioned the post.

Matt appears to be rocking the Zappa-style - a handlebar moustache connected with a goatee under the lips.

One of the show's runner-ups Jessica Brody struggled to understand the new look commenting: 'Who's that?'

She loves it! The 32-year-old debuted a scruffy handle moustache in an Instagram photo his girlfriend Chelsie McLeod shared on Tuesday

Fans were equally divided on the new facial hair after he ditched his familiar clean-cut look.

'Oh looks gorgeous, love men with facial hair,' one woman wrote.

'Everyone might calm down now,' another commented.

Meanwhile, Matt was left impressed when Chelsea gave him a temporary tattoo of the love chemical oxytocin on The Bachelor.

And last Thursday he revealed his love actually had more than one copy made of the scientific stencil made up.

Matt took to Instagram to share a black and white photo of the heartwarming diagrams.

Clearly smitten with her sweet gesture, wrote in the caption: 'She made copies'.

Oxytocin has played a special part in the development of their romance on the show.

During their date in the semi-final, Matt surprised the blonde beauty by gifting her with a necklace engraved with the chemical formula for oxytocin.
description: He's the handsome astrophysicist who drove the girls wild with his clean-cut looks while starring on The Bachelor.
authors: Tom Place For Daily Mail Australia
